alert.note: Alert for Harper (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Harper County through 800 PM CDT... At 730 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Anthony, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anthony, Harper, Attica, Danville, Freeport, Runnymede and Crystal Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central Kansas.
